translation.en: Mike down, mike down. There you go, now go.
You'd think I'd never done this. Ready?
Come with us tonight as we travel along with--
translation.ko: 오늘 저희가 찾은 곳은 다름 아닌∙∙∙

translation.en: You got a little hair thing. Hold on.
Come with us tonight as we paint the town red on The Night Shift.
translation.ko: 오늘 저희 '야간 근무'와 멋진 밤을 보내 보시죠

translation.en: Sorry, a little off my A-game. I'll get there.
That wasn't bad. The second part just seemed a little pushed, though.
On tonight's Night Shift, we're in Los Angeles...
translation.ko: 오늘 '야간 근무'는 멀리 LA에 와 있습니다

translation.en: ...traveling along with that special breed of hero we like to call...
We should have come earlier. We could be going with them.
Well, that's cool. You got it?
-Yeah, that's great. That was perfect. -We'll wait for them to get back.
Tell us, Bob, what's a normal night here at the station?
...but 85 percent of the calls we go out on are medical.
It can be anything from chest pain to more serious things.
How do you handle that with ambulances and hospitals?
Most ambulances you see are fire department.
translation.ko: 여러분이 보시는 구급차 대부분은 저희 거죠

translation.en: And most firefighters are also paramedics.
At least, that's the direction it's going.
translation.ko: 소방관은 구급 요원이기도 하죠 그런 교육을 시키고 있죠

translation.en: One more question, something I'm sure we're all wondering:
translation.ko: 한 가지 더, 아마 모두 궁금한 게 있을 텐데요

translation.en: Do firefighters still slide down those fabulous poles?
Tell my mom I loved her.
I'm glad I didn't wear a skirt. That could really hurt your legs.
Tell me, Bob, how do you get down when you're wearing a skirt?
That's what they wear under their, what, their turnouts.

translation.ko: - 화재 방지 효과가 있는 거요 - 확인하셨죠?

translation.en: -Can I do it one more time? -Sure.
-We're going to the dining hall. -All right.
-Couple of guys I want you to meet. -Cool.
These are the men you'll be shadowing. Wherever they go, you go.
translation.ko: 오늘 이 두 사람과 동행하며 취재하면 됩니다

translation.en: Cool. Please, oh, please, finish eating. We'll talk after.
-You should try some of the food. -Yeah, I'm game.
-Please finish eating. -We'll get you a plate.
Just maybe un-tuck your shirt and stick it up here.
Elliot's been telling me I never give him enough B-roll...
...so I'm just gonna shoot it all.
If you could keep from rubbing into the mike too much--
Can you say something? Give me a level?
You can just pretend it's not there. Just talk free.
Can you say something more compelling?
I don't know what to say--
I mean, am I gonna have this thing on all the time?
Yeah, just watch what you say. We'll hear everything.
You're probably not allowed to swear on your station.
No. We can cut most of it out.
But it helps if you're not dropping F-bombs.
So if I was to call this guy an ass-monkey...
...that would be considered a swear too, right?
It's gonna be a long night.
Is this some sort of torture device when you don't get in your turnouts?
-That's what it is. -Can you get it?
Yes. This is called a hook ladder.
We use this in the-- The firemen would use this--
So this was used in the '20s and the '30s.
...these are the rungs, and the hook at the end...
...they would grasp onto one window and then pull themselves up.
translation.ko: 창문 턱에 걸치고 나서 올라가는 식이죠

translation.en: And then when they got to that windowsill, they would hook it again.

translation.ko: 올라갔으면 위층에 다시 걸고 - 올라가고요 - 네

translation.en: Did you get the hook, Scott? You see this?
Used in the '20s and '30s. They stopped using it around--
translation.ko: 여기 찍어요 보여요? 그러다가 사용이 중지된 게∙∙∙
그러다가 사용이 중지된 게∙∙∙ - 더 높이요 - 그러니까∙∙∙

translation.en: Replaced it with a regular ladder that extends?
translation.ko: - 됐죠? - 좋아요 지금 같은 사다리로 바뀐 거죠?
지금 같은 사다리로 바뀐 거죠? 밧줄도 있고요

translation.en: They must have tiny feet. Those are little rungs.
Yeah. Firemen were a lot smaller back then.
The fires were bigger and they were smaller.
-Don't tell captain we took this down. -I'm not gonna tell him I touched it.
translation.ko: - 내렸다고 말하지 마세요 - 만졌다고 하면 큰일 나죠

translation.en: I wanna introduce you to somebody. This is Wilshire. Mark.
-Say hi. -Dog right out of the cartoons.
Well, there's a reason why the Dalmatians were in cartoons.
The fire department has a great sense of tradition.
Dalmatians got along well with horses.
Important when the fire trucks were horse-drawn.
But what they're trained to do is run in and stop the traffic.
That's what I do, I run out there. Sort of like what a siren does today.
translation.ko: 제가 그런 일을 하죠 사이렌 대신에요

translation.en: Okay, well, Wilshire can show you what to do in case you catch on fire.
translation.ko: 윌셔가 불이 붙었을 때의 대처법을 보여 드립니다

translation.en: So let's just pretend you're 5 years old and on fire.
You're not gonna be on fire.
So it's stop, drop and roll, in case you catch on fire. Wilshire.
translation.ko: 몸에 불이 붙으면 윌셔처럼 하시면 돼요

translation.en: -Yeah, you know, have some fun. -You all hang out a lot?
Yeah, we definitely live together. Close quarters.
...so we have everything we need in this place...
...from, you know, a small gym to this handball court.
translation.ko: 작은 체육관에 미식 핸드볼 코트도 있죠

translation.en: Sir, you got a call on the office line.
Can you pick up a call on the office line?
-I was hoping we'd get a call. -Yeah.
Not a big one, a little call so we can see action.
translation.ko: 큰 사건 말고 작은 거요 출동하는 걸 찍게요

translation.en: Gotta be annoying when trying to finish a game.
Every time, you know, we go respond to a call...
Depending on which side you're on, it's sort of nice.
Works in your favor from time to time?
Not in my favor. What are you talking about?
I think I'd roller-skate if I had access to this.
I can see you doing that. Yeah.
Okay, so this is where the men store their boots and turnouts.
The pole hole is over here.
-The pole hole. -Yeah, interesting name, I know.
translation.ko: "주의, 쇠봉 구멍" - 쇠봉 구멍 - 듣고 보니 이상하네요

translation.en: Our viewers always like to see action...
...so maybe we should go into the locker room.
-Let's go in the locker room. -You got it.
-Right this way. -I was kidding, I was kidding.
Okay, towel up, guys. We got a female on deck.
That's Griffin. He can't sing very well.
He's got one major talent, so come this way.
-He's got a huge talent. -We're not using this.
Here. We have different hoses at the station, and this is the Griffin hose.
translation.ko: 호스도 종류가 많은데 이건 그리핀 호스입니다

translation.en: You know, I hope that's a wide-angle lens.
This is adding a whole new meaning to the term fireman's hose.
translation.ko: 소방관 호스 중에 저런 것도 있었네요

translation.en: I understand why there are no women here.
Okay, I think I can be a firefighter.
-Yeah, it's a lot harder than it seems. -Keep the door closed.
translation.ko: - 보기보다 훨씬 어려워요 - 문 열지 마

translation.en: You know what? Pick something you're good at.
I bet you $10 I can do it better. You all can be my witnesses.
I think we're done here. We got everything we need.
Did you know you were gonna be on camera?
-Ten bucks. -You can't be in the way.
I'm just saying. You guys ready?
-Yes. You owe her 10 bucks, man. -Ten dollars.
Just waiting on something to happen.
You wanna go back outside? See what they're up to?
I think they're talking about you.
Will you turn up his mike?
You didn't catch no eye. Here, give me some of that.
translation.ko: 날 좋아하나 봐 그것 좀 줘

translation.en: A hundred bucks says I can bang her by the morning.
translation.ko: 아침까지 나한테 넘어온다에 백 달러 걸게

translation.en: -Sorry, what? -I said you missed a spot.
Oh, I know how to hit the spot. Don't you worry about that.
I'll hold your camera. You go kick his ass, okay?
translation.ko: 카메라 나한테 주고 가서 한 대 때리고 와요

translation.en: That's how you do pick and roll.
Oh, yeah? Is that how you do it?
He'll show you how to do it later.
...and the firefighters take turns sleeping in these rooms here.
But if the alarm rings, they can be up and on the truck in under one minute.
translation.ko: 하지만 경보가 울리면 1분 내에 소방차에 오릅니다

translation.en: It's like my college dorm without the pink.
Looks like you got your call.
-We're going to the pole hole. -Come on, come on.
Come here, come here, come this way.
Careful, okay? We have to get on that truck.
What kind of call is this?
-Okay. -We'll find out when we get there.
You seem to have kept shooting.
Most little girls wanna be ballerinas or princesses when they grow up.
I used to tell my mom, "Someday, I'm gonna grow up and be a fireman."
translation.ko: 전 어릴 때 소방관이 되고 싶다고 했죠

translation.en: Tonight, I am truly living the dream.
It's so loud, I don't think we can use any of it.
translation.ko: 저 소리가 커서 이건 못 쓰겠어

translation.en: Scott, I am still living the dream.
All right, we got a eight at 3 o'clock.
Keep calling out numbers. What are you doing?
...but I have the most important job.
No, I'm in charge of the chick-o-meter.
When I see a girl, I rate them.
So if I say there's a eight at 3 o'clock...
...the guys know they better look to the right.
You know, it's really funny. I always thought firemen were so dignified.
Oh, no, no. I signed up for brave and courageous.
-I don't do dignified. -Yeah, I think we get that by now.
translation.ko: - 점잖은 건 필요 없어요 - 네, 이제 깨달았어요

translation.en: It's called a chick-o-meter, not a dick-o-meter.
translation.ko: 여자만 채점해요 거시기 달린 쪽은 빼줘요

translation.en: You're fired. You can't talk anymore.
So where do you think the problem is?
Do you think it's over there, around the corner?
To the core, baby. To the core.
What are you taking with you?
Really anything we might need to break a lock or open a door.
-You're the one who called this in? -Yeah.
I didn't know they made them that new.
Police are here. Might be more serious than we thought.
A woman was screaming bloody murder up there.
-It's Mrs. Espinoza. -Two cops are up there.
-When did they get here? -Five minutes ago.
-Go back to your apartments. -We heard screams.
Well, at least get out of the way.
-Are they with you? -Yeah. They're shadowing us.
I tell you not to film something, don't film it.
-I tell you to get lost, you get lost. -No problem.
Here on the second floor on the right. It's an old woman, lives alone.
Probably fell. Neighbors heard screams, called it in.
You wouldn't believe the way she screamed. It was crazy.
Neighbors say she's weird. Doesn't talk to anybody.
-I told them not to get in the way. -Great. That's all we need.
Hello, ma'am, can you hear me? It's L.A.P.D.
I'm here with paramedics. We're gonna come in to help you.
If you're near the door, I need you to move away from it.
-Hey, I got the keys. -Then get in here, sir. Come on.
Just a second. Yeah, here we are.
-I'm gonna do an intro. -Yeah, you're good.
Okay. We're standing outside an elderly woman's apartment.
The fire department's about to begin the rescue.
Police say that she lives alone, she's not very social--
translation.ko: 경찰 말로는 이웃과 왕래도 없이 혼자∙∙∙

translation.en: I need you to get back, brother, please, this time.
There's no need to worry, Mrs. Espinoza. We're here to help you.
It's all right, is there anybody else in the apartment? Any more animals?
It's all right. It's all right.
We're gonna get you some medical help.
No, are you okay? Are you okay, ma'am?
You're gonna be okay. You're gonna be okay, all right?
Hey, chief, we're gonna need an ambulance here.
Mrs. Espinoza, it's all gonna be all right.
All right, I just need you to calm down, okay?
It's all right. Nobody's here to hurt you.
We can't help you unless you calm down.
-An ambulance is on its way right now. -All right.
Danny, get everybody out of here until the ambulance gets here.
translation.ko: 대니, 구급차 올 때까지 모두 나가게 해

translation.en: Get her off. Get off. Get her off.
Get him on the floor. Get him on the floor.
No. We are not moving him.
-We are waiting for the ambulance. -Do you see an ambulance?
We have to get him downstairs.
-All right. Come on, come on. Okay. -Grab the arm.
Come on. Come on, I got it.
I got her. I got her.
-Get the fuck out of the way. -Go, Scott.
Come on, let's go, let's go.
-Be careful down the stairs. -Hang in there, buddy.
Tape everything, you hear me? Tape everything.
-What do you mean? -They won't let us out.
Something is closing it from outside.
Open the door. Open the door.
Is there a doctor in the house?
-Put some pressure on that wound. -Give me that rag.
Why are they locking if there's a fire?
There's no fire, Wanda. There is no fire.
We have an officer down. We have an officer down.
I need an ambulance immediately. I need backup.
I have a fucking hurt officer here.
What's going on? Hey, what's happening?
I know no more than you do right now.
My partner's on the floor bleeding.
We are working hard to get you out of the building.
This will all be over shortly.
-What will all be over? -What's going on?
Why are we locked in our building?
Be calm. That's what that means.
Please remain calm and everything's-- Get the camera out of here.
Don't touch the camera. We have every right to shoot.
-I'm tired of the camera. -People need to see what's going on.
I'm in charge here. Turn it off--
If you were, you'd be worried about getting your partner out.
You are two steps from being arrested, okay?
This man will bleed to death.
Everybody stop fighting, okay? Stop fighting.
We need to get this man out of here.
-What's behind that door? -That's a fabric workshop.
-Is there a way out from there? -Yeah, through the back. Come, come.
translation.ko: - 밖이랑 통하나요? - 네, 뒤로 통하죠, 오세요

translation.en: You're not helping the situation. Okay?
My husband's outside. Said there are cops.
Blocked off the street. He was getting antibiotics.
-Don't move him. -No, we have to, we have to.
All right, he's still got a pulse.
Get the vet over here. Get the vet now.
He's still got a pulse. Take care of him.
All right. Come with me, let's go.
Come on, come on. You two stay here, all right?
Keep an eye on my partner, please.
The sound's coming from in there.
What are you two doing here? Get the camera back.
We need to get you guys out of here.
Ma'am, listen to me. Can you hear me, Miss Espinoza?
I need you to stay right where you are, okay?
All right? We wanna help you here.
Put your hands in the air for me, Mrs. Espinoza.
Okay? Put your hands in the air.
Put the gun down. Let's go.
-You saw that, right? -Yeah, I saw it.
Let's just get downstairs. Let's get downstairs.
-Look, don't worry. I got it. -I said show it to me!
-What the hell was that? -I don't know. I think--
We should probably just get down the stairs, okay?
I know, I know, I know.
-Oh, my God. -We just have to get downstairs.
I need you to open up the door.
Fire department. We need everyone to gather downstairs in the atrium.
Yes, we need you to go downstairs.
-Was there a fire? -No, it's just a precaution.
Look, we just need you to get downstairs.
Does this have anything to do with the cable being out?
translation.ko: 그래서 케이블 방송이 안 나오는 거요?

translation.en: -Come on, let's go. -What? Wait, wait, wait.
-What if I don't wanna go? -Then I'd be forced to force you.
Hi. I'm with the fire department.
We need everyone to gather in the atrium.
Do you speak English? Do you speak English?
Okay, we need everybody downstairs, so....
All right, there's people down there, and we need you two to go there.
Ma'am, I'm with the fire department.
We need you to quickly and calmly walk down to the lobby, please.
Ma'am, we need you to get downstairs, okay?
-I don't know that that's a good idea. -She needs help.
We're just taking you downstairs, okay, ma'am?
Holy shit. Did you see that?
That rat just totally came after me. Hey, did you see that?
-Oh, my God, look at Elise. -Somebody grab that chair.
-What's wrong with her? -Set her down, set her down.
Can't stop the bleeding. Get him to a hospital. He's gonna die.
translation.ko: 출혈이 안 멈춰요 이대로 가면 죽어요

translation.en: Stay here. I'm gonna check the exit.
No, no, wait. We are under strict orders--
We're under orders to stay in the hall. Help me.
Fuck your orders, all right? My friend's dying!
-Didn't catch that. You're breaking up. -Two people have died.
translation.ko: - 이러면 안 돼요 - 주민 둘이 사망했습니다

translation.en: Two others are in need of medical care. Police have blocked off the exit.
translation.ko: 다른 두 명은 치료가 필요한데 경찰이 출구를 봉쇄했습니다

translation.en: They've given us no explanation. We're trying to find a way out.
translation.ko: 아무런 설명도 없이요 우린 나가려고 합니다

translation.en: You need to remain in the building.
Attention, please. Do not try to leave the building.
All exits have been sealed. Just stay calm.
We will send someone in there shortly to assess the situation.
translation.ko: 잠시 후 상황을 파악하고자 관계자가 갈 겁니다

translation.en: What are we supposed to do?
-What are we supposed to do? -Just wait.
No, you're not getting my question.
I'm asking why they're calling this a BNC.
Why is the phone breaking? Why is it not working?
What's a BNC? What is it?
A biological, nuclear or chemical threat.
-It's more common than you think. -Supposed to be reassuring?
translation.ko: - 생각보다 자주 일어나요 - 퍽 위안이 되네요

translation.en: Our cell phones don't work. Neither do the TVs or our radios.
-Why are they isolating us? -I don't know.
You can't keep us trapped here.
We are all trapped in here. Step over here.
There might be-- From the office on the second floor, there is an overhang.
Maybe we can use to jump down to the patio.
I don't want anyone knowing we're in here.
--go to the right side and jump.
It's only two and a half meters.
Can you see me? Can you see me?
-What are you doing? -We have a film crew in here.
Tell your boss we have a TV crew in here.
translation.ko: TV 방송 직원이 있다고 위에 전해요

translation.en: We are filming this. Please, wait.
translation.ko: 다 찍고 있어요 제발, 안 돼요

translation.en: People are gonna see what you're doing to us.
-Why can't we go out? -People are gonna see this.
translation.ko: - 왜 못 나가게 해요? - 이런 거 다 알릴 거예요

translation.en: What are you doing in here?
-You knew about this, didn't you? -Knew what?
That they're sealing us in here.
I don't know anything and don't you fucking put your hands on me again.
translation.ko: 몰라요, 그리고 다신 나한테 손대지 마요

translation.en: We need to show people what's going on here.
-Only proof we have. -Don't you get it?
You're locked in here like us. You think they give a shit about you?
translation.ko: 당신도 갇혔는데 신경 써줄 것 같아요?

translation.en: -Let's all just calm down, all right? -Shut up.
This thing is getting to all of us.
No one here is gonna hurt you, okay?
We're trying to get out. That's all we're trying to do.
I was just freaked out. Let's go.
Grab his legs, okay? Come on, let's go.
What we'll do is we'll roll him on his side.
We just have to be really careful.
It's 1:37 in the morning, and everyone is scared.
They've given us no information, cut off communication...
...from walkie-talkies and cell phones to the building's cable and Internet.
The people trapped here, myself included...
Listen, I've got a ton of Vicodin in my apartment, if that will help.
I'll just-- I'll grab a bunch of stuff.
I basically got a pharmacy up there.
You can't arrest me for that, because of self-incrimination--
translation.ko: 체포 사유는 안 되죠 이런 진술은∙∙∙

translation.en: Sir, you are the least of my worries right now, okay?
translation.ko: 그런 건 안중에 없으니 걱정 놓으세요

translation.en: Do what you're gonna do, please.
You ever seen anything like this before?
No, I've never seen anything like this.
I don't usually treat people. Dogs and cats, mostly.
translation.ko: 사람이 아닌 개나 고양이 등을 치료하죠

translation.en: All I can really do is I can dress their wounds and try to comfort them.
translation.ko: 여기선 붕대 감아주고 편안하게 해주는 정도예요

translation.en: How are the injured men doing?
They both lost a lot of blood, and the fireman over here...
...he's got a bunch of broken bones and probable internal bleeding.
Apparently, Mrs. Espinoza attacked and bit them in some kind of a fit.
translation.ko: 에스피노자 부인이 발작 상태에서 문 거죠

translation.en: But honestly, I find that a little hard to believe...
...that an old lady could do something like this to two grown men.
translation.ko: 할머니가 장성한 두 남자에게 이럴 수 있다는 게요

translation.en: Briana, that's a very pretty name. How old are you, Briana?
translation.ko: 참 예쁜 이름이구나 몇 살이지, 브리아나?

translation.en: With my mom and my dad and my dog, Max.
Max. I haven't met Max. Where is he?
My dad took him to the vet because he's sick.
-She's had it for weeks, it's not like-- -You know what?
If you don't mind, I'd like to keep you quiet while I interview Briana.
translation.ko: 인터뷰 중엔 말씀 안 하시면 좋겠어요

translation.en: It confuses the audience when people talk from off-camera.
-Oh, God, I'm sorry. -No, no, it's okay.
Yeah, I don't like being sick either.
Briana, you're a very brave girl...
...and I'm really happy we got a chance to meet.
She's been fearless since she was little.
Why don't you just start by introducing yourselves?
Well, I'm Ber-- I'm Bernard. This is my roommate, Sadie.
translation.ko: 전 버나드입니다 여긴 같이 사는 세이디고요

translation.en: And how long have you lived in the building?
I've been here two and a half years.
And what do you do for a living?
Sadie's my best student, my protégé.
Where the hell is the doctor?
I got him, got him, got him.
Hold him, hold him. Hold his neck, hold his neck.
-Hold it over, hold his neck. -Go, go, go.
Oh, my God, is he still alive?
Hold him still, hold him still. He's gonna go down.
No, no, stay here, stay here. No, the dog will come back.
-Okay, I have to show you something. -What?
Have to show you something. Just a sec.
I think I know what this is.
Her tear ducts and salivary glands are constantly flowing.
She seems to be unable to swallow or speak.
She has a fever, she's confused.
She has some degree of paralysis and delirium.
Never seen it in humans, but I know what rabies look like.
translation.ko: 인간에게선 못 봤지만 광견병은 잘 알아요

translation.en: Are you trying to tell me these people have rabies?
Tears, saliva, fever. They have what she has.
But here's the thing. Rabies takes months for symptoms to show.
translation.ko: 근데 광견병은 발병까지 몇 달이 걸리죠

translation.en: This is taking minutes. I mean, rabies never acts this fast.
translation.ko: 근데 이건 불과 몇 분만에 나타나요

translation.en: How does rabies spread? Through bites?
No, it's passed through anything wet. Blood, saliva, any mucous membrane.
translation.ko: 체액을 통해 전염돼요 혈액이나 침, 점막 등

translation.en: So if you get their blood on you, you're okay.
But if you get their blood on you...
...and it gets into a cut, into your mouth, eyes...
People get shots in their stomach.
Once symptoms show, rabies is 100 percent fatal.
-Where are you going? Where? -I'm going up to my apartment.
-Why can't I go? -We gonna do this all night?
-You know why? -Because it's not safe there.
Oh, yeah, because it's really safe down here.
It seems to me, if this is spreading, maybe we should separate...
translation.ko: 전염이 되는 거라면 모일 게 아니라

translation.en: ...instead of sitting here in a big group.
I have a God-given right to protect myself as I see fit, so you know what?
translation.ko: 나름대로 자신을 보호할 권리가 있단 말이오

translation.en: I'm gonna go and I'm gonna barricade the shit out of it.
-Where do you think they're going? -You can all sit here and rot.
Oh, you are so close to going to jail.
-Are you some kind of affirmative--? -You are so close to going to jail.
translation.ko: - 경관 된 거 흑인이라 특혜∙∙∙ - 계속 이러면 체포합니다

translation.en: Look, this lets out right next to our apartment.
We wanna see if there's anything on the news about this.
We still use rabbit ears on our TV.
translation.ko: 우린 소형 안테나 놓고 TV 봐요

translation.en: We're going with you. Wait, wait, wait, we're going with you.
It's just up here to the right.

translation.ko: 안 돼, 저리 가 저리 가!

translation.en: We can't just open the door. We need something to hold the dog back with.
translation.ko: 문 열면 안 돼요 방어할 수단이 있어야 해요

translation.en: Turn it off, Scott. Turn it off.
-Shouldn't we shut the door? -Close the door.
It usually takes a couple of seconds to....
No, I know what I'm doing.
Tell us why the CDC is entering the building.
What the fuck is going on here?
Sadie, stay with me. Sadie, come here.
Stay with me. It cannot be.
-Stay with me. -You gotta close that door.
Angela, you have blood all over your shirt.
I mean, I just killed something with my camera...
-I'm with you, you're with me, okay? -Okay, okay, okay, we're here.
We get out of here as fast as we fucking can, you hear me?
All right, it's been a long, exhausting night for all of us...
...but we just got word from outside.
Well, it's about bloody fucking time, isn't it?
Yes, they told me they're sending in the CDC.
Yes, but relax, it's fine. They're gonna come in.
They're gonna run blood tests on residents to clarify things.
Everybody, so once they check it out...
...make sure everything's okay, we should be able to get out.
-What are you talking about? -That doesn't work, not for rabies.
translation.ko: - 무슨 말이에요? - 광견병은 그렇게 안 돼요

translation.en: -Nobody said anything about rabies. -I did, I told you it was rabies.
How do you test for rabies?
There's only one way. You gotta get a brain sample.
-What you have to do. -Let's make sure everyone's here.
translation.ko: - 그 수밖에 없어요 - 다들 왔나 봅시다
- 각 층에 아파트 개수는요? - 세 개요

translation.en: Second floor, Unit A, that's where Mrs. Espinoza lives?
All right, third floor, Unit A. Who's up there?
That's me, my daughter and my husband, who's been outside--
Yes, yes, yes, we know. Thank you.
-My wife and me. -Who's in Unit C?
-Fourth floor, Unit A, who's up there? -That was Elise. She's dead.
-4B, who's in B? -It's me, me, here.
They don't understand you. Them and her father.
Maybe this is all his fault.
-How do you know? You don't know-- -Listen up, all right, let's finish up.
translation.ko: - 함부로 말하지 마요 - 자, 이제 마무리합시다

translation.en: What was I even gonna say? Who lives in the attic?
A man from Boston. He rents it, but I haven't seen him in months.
translation.ko: 보스턴에서 온 사람인데 몇 달을 못 봤어요

translation.en: Wait, if her father's upstairs, should we bring him down?
What if he's the cause? We can't bring sick people here.
-Your daughter's sick, isn't she? -She has fever. Hardly the same.
translation.ko: - 꼬마애도 아프죠? - 그냥 열만 있는 거예요

translation.en: Yeah, so we should bring her father downstairs.
-Listen. -How many times you gonna do this?
Nobody's going. We're gonna stay here.
They'll let us know when they wanna move us, period.
translation.ko: 때가 되면 언제 나갈지 알려줄 겁니다

translation.en: -The cleaning lady was here. -I saw her this morning.
CDC's now making their way into the building.
There are security measures in place.
We still have no idea what's happening.
From the look of the precaution that they're taking...
I want you to just keep this area clear.
This is blood from my partner here.
He's in the back. This blood is from the second firefighter.
translation.ko: 뒤에 있습니다, 이건 다른 소방관 혈흔이고요

translation.en: You, turn it off. Turn it off now.
Okay, everyone here. Everybody here is good.
The two guys are in the back. That's all we can tell you.
-I don't know anything else right now. -Okay.
Just take me to the injured. Everyone else stays here.
translation.ko: 부상자에게 갑시다 나머진 여기 있게 해요

translation.en: They tell us to stay calm, and they come dressed like that?
-It's gonna be all right. -What? You honestly believe that?
translation.ko: - 별일 아닐 겁니다 - 그 말을 믿어요?

translation.en: I'm gonna take samples from both men.
Give me the camera, come on.
The other one's got a syringe.
He just gave Fletcher a shot.
I think the vet was right.
I think he's taking a brain sample.
The vet's in there. He's still in there.
-Open the door. -We can't, he's been bitten.
-Come on, let him out. -I'm not infected, you're wrong.
translation.ko: - 나오게 해요 - 나 감염 안 됐어요

translation.en: I'm not infected. I'm all right.
-They didn't get me. -What are you talking about?
-Are you sure he's been bitten? -Yes, and I'm not taking any chances.
translation.ko: - 물린 게 확실해요? - 네, 모험을 할 순 없어요

translation.en: Back away till the infected people have been handcuffed.
translation.ko: 감염자들에게 수갑을 채울 때까진 안 돼요

translation.en: -Would you get that out of my face? -What happens happens in the open.
They have a right to shoot this, okay?
-It's not right. -It would not be right to let him out--
translation.ko: - 이럴 순 없어요 - 열어줘선 안 돼요

translation.en: You tell us what's going on.
You left my friend because he tried to kill you.
-Tell us what you know. -Yeah, okay, goddamn, okay.
We got a call from a vet who had a sick dog brought in.
They ran the routine tests, it was nothing they'd ever seen before.
translation.ko: 개를 검사했는데 처음 보는 게 나왔다면서요

translation.en: Then it started attacking the other animals.
And within an hour, all the injured animals...
translation.ko: 한 시간도 안 돼 물린 동물들도

translation.en: Yeah. The dog's collar led us to this building.
translation.ko: 그 개 인식표를 보니 여기가 주소로 돼 있더군요

translation.en: Relax, ma'am. Relax. We have to be sure.
Dog spread the infection through his saliva.
That's all she has, just bronchitis.
-Get the girl. -No, get away from her.
-Come on, come on. -No, let me go.
Please, you need to get us out of here.
Back away. Calm down, calm down, calm down.
-Her father's sick in bed. -Nobody told me that.
translation.ko: - 부친이 환자예요 - 왜 말 안 했어요?

translation.en: We thought everyone was down here.
Get the girl and inject her with it.
-No, no. -And you, bring everybody down here.
translation.ko: - 안 돼 - 당신은 사람들 다 데려오고요

translation.en: Kathy, we're gonna get her. We're gonna bring her down.
Slow down, slow down, slow down.
-Where the hell's the old lady? -The old lady's gone.
Okay. Just take it easy, okay?
Oh, I think she's in here, Jake.
She's over there. She's over there.
Now, I need you to give me your hand, okay?
Oh, they're getting out. Run, run!
-Don't leave me. -I'm not gonna leave her.
-Don't leave me. -We have to get out of here.
It's not right! It's not right!
-Come on. -No, no, not that way. This way.
Hurry up, come on. Where are the others?
-Lock it, lock it, lock it! -Hurry up.
Jake, did you find the little girl?
Who gives a shit about the little girl?
All right. We've lost control of the building.
I don't understand. They were biting her face off.
I don't know what the fuck is happening.
We could all be infected by now. We gotta get out of here.
-I'm not moving. -Hey, we wait here, we wait here.
-We have to get out of here. -Listen.
We have to stay here and wait till somebody come and get us.
translation.ko: 누가 구해주러 올 때까지 여기 있어요

translation.en: They're not gonna come and get us.
-Oh, yes, they will. -They are not gonna come!
They don't give a shit about us! They're gonna let us die!
translation.ko: 상관 안 할 거예요 우린 죽어요!

translation.en: It's not gonna hold him for long.
Hey, hey, hey, you're not gonna fucking touch her.
We gotta get out. Gotta get out.
Gotta get out of here. Gotta get out of here. Come on.
Help me get out of here.
Let me get out of here, please.
They're not gonna let us out of here alive, are they?
translation.ko: 죽어야 내보내 줄 것 같아요 그렇죠?

translation.en: Jake, there might be a way out.
How? How do we get out of here?
There is a drain cover in the basement that joins up with the sewers.
-We need the key, we need the key. -The keys are in our apartment.
translation.ko: - 거기 열쇠가 필요해요 - 내 방에 있어요

translation.en: Come with us! You have to come with us!
I won't leave him. I can't leave him.
We have to get out of here! We have to get the key.
Key's in Yuri's apartment. Know where he lives?
You made the list of residents. Where does he live?
I can't remember where it's at.
You have to think about it. Think, think, think.
I don't know which apartment. I don't know which apartment it is.
translation.ko: 몇 호인지 도무지 기억 안 나요

translation.en: -Grab the hammer. -I got it, I got it.
Oh, keep moving, man. Keep moving.
Where is it? Which one is it?
It should run on auxiliary power. We're good.
She's cuffed. We can get by.
But it's gonna stop at two. We're gonna stop at two!
Come on. Come on, you should get that hammer, Jake.
They won't close. They won't close.
No, you haven't. I saw it.
Angie, Angie, they didn't get you. You didn't get bitten.
-Look at me, Angie. Come on, baby. -No!
-Baby, come on, look at me. -Man, let's go.
You did not get bit. Look at me. You did not get bit.
-I saw it, I saw it. -We have to go.
Come on. Come on! Let's go.
This is 3B right here. Right here.
-Keep the light on my hands, Scott. -Okay.
-Find them. -I don't see it, I don't see.
-The light, the light, the light. -I'm bringing it back to you.
No, no, he wouldn't leave them in there.
Hey, he wouldn't leave them in there.
I got them, but I don't know which one it is.
-Which one is it, Scott? -Take them all.
Angela, Angela, I need you to be quiet.
We need to get three flights of stairs down to the basement, okay?
I need you to stay tight.
I need you to stay close and stay fast, okay?
-Are you ready? All right, all right. -Yeah, yeah, yeah.
-All right, we can do this. -Got it.
Scott, come on. Come on, Scott.
Hey, we gotta go up. Come on.
-Gonna be an old one. Oh, God. -Go.
-It's gotta be an old one, Scott. -I know, pick the key.
translation.ko: - 오래된 열쇠일 거예요 - 그래, 빨리 해

translation.en: -I'm finding it, I'm finding it! -Come on.
-Turn the light on. -It'll come back on.
-I need the light on! -It will come back on.
There we go, there we go, there we go. Okay? Okay, listen.
translation.ko: 됐어, 됐어 진정하고 내 말 들어

translation.en: I think they went away. Oh, damn, damn.
Okay, so this place was locked up.
What that means, probably, is there ain't nobody in here. No one.
Yeah, let's find a way out.
Oh, what is this place, Scott?
-Oh, please, keep the light on. -I got you, I got you.
Stay with me. Stay with me.

translation.ko: '컬트 탈퇴자가 말한 세상을 멸할 바이러스' 대체 뭐야?

translation.en: Oh, God. Oh, it's all the same kind of stuff.
Oh, God, let's get out of here, please.
Okay, come on. Come on, grab my hand.
Grab my hand, it's me, it's me. Look at it, look at it.
Just come around this pole. Let me lead.
Let me lead. I'm right with you.
That's the way, okay? Okay, come on.
Hey, hey, my bad, my bad.
We're gonna have to go through that door.
I just need you to open it.
You're gonna let me look in first.
Just push it and stand back.
Come on, come on, Angie. Angie, let's go in there.
-Please, get the light on me, okay? -Come on.
Oh, this is so fucked. I don't know.
Oh, shit, stick with me, stick with me. Come on.
-Keep the light on, keep the light on. -What is it?
What is it? What the hell?
Who is this? Who is this?
I don't know what to do with it.
Oh, God, oh, God, oh, God.
Come on. We don't know what's up there.
Okay, I'm gonna take the camera.
Listen to me, listen to me. I'm gonna take the camera.
-I'm gonna take a look up there. -No, no.
We can't stay the fuck down here. We can't stay here.
I won't have a light if you go up there!
-Angie, Angie, stay with me. -I'll be in the dark!
Look, I'm gonna have to take this light off you.
Here, grab my waist. Okay, just grab my waist.
-Oh, something hit the camera. -Don't turn it off, fix it.
Look, I'm gonna put the night vision on.
I'll put the night vision on. Hold on.
Okay. Okay, I can see you now, okay?
Yeah, yeah. Okay, I'm gonna stick my hand out, okay?
Hey, it's me, it's me, it's me, okay?
Okay, good. Come on, come on.
Hey, you're doing good. Come around.
Come around my back. Hold on.
Hold on. We'll be okay, okay?
I just gotta find us a way out of here.
I'll find a way out, I promise.
What's that? Stay still, stay still.
Don't make a sound. Don't make a sound.
If it can't hear us, it won't find us.
translation.ko: 소리도 안 내면 못 찾을 거야

translation.en: Okay, get ready. We're gonna try to get by it.
